After recording a handful of sessions for Blue Note in the early Ã¢â‚¬Ëœ60s (including two albums as a leader), organist Baby Face Willette abruptly left the label and soon resurfaced on Argo. Issued on the Argo label in 1964, these two albums are a prime example of soulful jazz organ from the time when funk was in its infancy.
